Created attachment 390631
initial implementation of Function.bind

Depends on attachement 390629

comments.author: norrisboyd@gmail.com

comments.author: norrisboyd@gmail.com
comments.body:
Also, from reviewing the patch:
* Could you make THROW_TYPE_ERROR lazily initialized rather than created in a static initializer? Static initializers doing complex initialization are a bit brittle.
* Why do you need to set 'get' and 'set' to THROW_TYPE_ERROR?

comments.author: rspeyer@gmail.com
comments.body:

comments.author: rspeyer@gmail.com
comments.body:
(In reply to comment #3)
> Also, from reviewing the patch:
> * Could you make THROW_TYPE_ERROR lazily initialized rather than created in a
> static initializer? Static initializers doing complex initialization are a bit
> brittle.

Sure, I'll submit a patch for that.

> * Why do you need to set 'get' and 'set' to THROW_TYPE_ERROR?

I'm modelling it on the [[ThrowTypeError]] object (13.2.3), as required by 15.3.4.5, steps 17-19. I'm using the version of the spec with errata as of 16th June.

comments.author: rspeyer@gmail.com
comments.body:
Created attachment 390824
lazily initialise ThrowTypeError

I'm assuming I don't have to worry about thread synchronisation here. Is that correct?

comments.author: norrisboyd@gmail.com
comments.body: Does it matter if you create two THROW_TYPE_ERROR objects because of a thread switch between the creation and the store to the static member? If not, then I'd say don't worry about thread synchronization.

comments.author: rspeyer@gmail.com
comments.body:
Well in principle thread 2 could return the object before thread 1 has called preventExtensions on it, and the spec requires that the object shouldn't be extensible. Not likely to cause a lot of harm though as I see it, but to be safe I could synchronize that access.

(In reply to comment #7)
> Does it matter if you create two THROW_TYPE_ERROR objects because of a thread
> switch between the creation and the store to the static member? If not, then
> I'd say don't worry about thread synchronization.

comments.author: norrisboyd@gmail.com
comments.body:
You could wait until after calling preventExtensions before assigning the object to the static. 

At any rate, not a big deal if you just want to synchronize.

comments.author: rspeyer@gmail.com
comments.body:
Created attachment 390845
made lazy initialisation safe in presence of multi-threading

by assigning to the shared variable after it's completely initialised.

comments.author: rspeyer@gmail.com
comments.body:
Created attachment 391087
moved handing of the this binding to execution of bound function

As per 15.3.4.5 step 6, and 10.4.3 of the spec
